result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Robert Powers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No violent or disorderly contact with TPR or minor child.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
Engage with mental health providers and continue treatment.

records.addlTxt: 2:38 PM Defendant Matthew R. Powers in court.  Attorney John K Smerlinski in court for Matthew R. Powers.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 1, 2 and 3; Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 4 is dismissed and read in.  Court orders sentence withheld, 3 years probation, any treatment deemed necessary, no violent or disorderly contact with TRP or minor child, AODA, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescriptin, engage with mental health providers and continue treatment, costs due to Clerk of Court, 0 days sentence credit.

INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER
TP

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:01 AM Defendant Matthew Robert Powers in court by video with attorney John K Smerlinski by video. David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Victim T.P present in court by video. Kim Rau in court by video for victim witness office. Court modifies bond conditions to: No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.R.P.'s family, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.R.P., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except by way of telephone and not to discuss the case with victim. Maintain absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. All previous conditions remain in effect. Defendant to sign modified bond at the Courthouse on May 25, 2022 between 12 and 1PM. Officer Victoria Dawson of Janesville Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. Officer Erin Briggs of Janesville Police Department sworn testimony taken by video. Deputy Clerk of Court Amy Sheridan sworn testimony taken by video. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty to misdemeanor charges and stands mute to felony charge, not guilty plea by court jury trial to be set.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.R.P.'s family, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact directly or indirectly with victim T.R.P., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except by way of telephone and not to discuss the case with victim. Maintain absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
